perturbation.original_text:
NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereto agree as follows:
Article 1 Interpretation
1.1 Definitions
In this Agreement, in addition to words and phrases defined where they are used, the following words and phrases shall have the following
meanings:
a) “Affiliate” of a Party shall mean any entity, directly or indirectly, controlling, controlled by, or under common control with a Party.
perturbation.changed_text:
NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Signatories hereto agree as follows:
Article 1 Interpretation
1.1 Definitions
In this Agreement, in addition to words and phrases defined where they are used, the following words and phrases shall have the following
meanings:
a) “Affiliate” of a Party shall mean any entity, directly or indirectly, controlling, controlled by, or under common control with a Company.
perturbation.explanation: Changed 'Parties' to 'Signatories', and 'Party' to 'Company'. This introduces a contradiction because the term 'Party' is still used in the definitions and other sections, creating confusion on whether 'Company' and 'Party' are equivalent.

perturbation.original_text:
3.1 Supply of Product
a) During the Term, Supplier shall Manufacture the Product and perform all Services at its facilities located at Bubendorf, Switzerland and at
Neuland, Switzerland (such facilities, the “Facilities” and each, a “Facility”). Supplier will supply to Customer or Customer’s designee, the Product,
Manufactured in accordance with the accepted Purchase Order placed by Customer, Master Batch Record, the Product Specifications, the Quality
Agreement and cGMP Requirements and, subject to Section 3.1(b), in such quantities as ordered by Customer in Purchase Orders submitted
pursuant to Section 6.1 and accepted pursuant to Section 6.2.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.1 Supply of Goods
a) During the Term, Vendor shall Manufacture the Goods and perform all Services at its plants located at Bubendorf, Switzerland and at
Neuland, Switzerland (such facilities, the “Plants” and each, a “Plant”). Vendor will supply to Client or Client’s designee, the Goods,
Manufactured in accordance with the accepted Purchase Order placed by Client, Master Batch Record, the Product Specifications, the Quality
Agreement and cGMP Requirements and, subject to Section 3.1(b), in such quantities as ordered by Client in Purchase Orders submitted
pursuant to Section 6.1 and accepted pursuant to Section 6.2.
perturbation.explanation: Changed 'Product' to 'Goods', 'Supplier' to 'Vendor', 'Facilities' to 'Plants' and 'Customer' to 'Client'. It's unclear if 'Vendor' and 'Client' still refers to the same entities described elsewhere in the contract as 'Supplier' and 'Customer', leading to uncertainty in obligations.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1 Acceptance of Shipments
Customer or its designees shall, within a period of [* * *] after the date of physical receipt of any shipment of Product from Supplier, inspect the
Product for any shortages or any defects or deviations of the Product
Specifications (hereinafter “Out Of Specification”) that would be apparent from visual inspections of the Product. In the event that Customer is of
the opinion that the Product is Out Of Specification at the time of delivery, Customer shall, within [* * *] after the date of physical receipt of
Product, provide Supplier with a written notice to reject the Product (a “Notice of Rejection”), which shall include a description of the grounds for
rejection and copies of test reports and testing methodology conducted on the Product, if any.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1 Acceptance of Deliveries
Client or its designees shall, within a period of [* * *] after the date of physical receipt of any delivery of Items from Vendor, inspect the
Items for any shortages or any defects or deviations of the Product
Specifications (hereinafter “Out Of Specification”) that would be apparent from visual inspections of the Items. In the event that Client is of
the opinion that the Items are Out Of Specification at the time of delivery, Client shall, within [* * *] after the date of physical receipt of
Items, provide Vendor with a written notice to reject the Items (a “Notice of Rejection”), which shall include a description of the grounds for
rejection and copies of test reports and testing methodology conducted on the Items, if any.
perturbation.explanation: Changed 'Shipments' to 'Deliveries', 'Product' to 'Items', 'Supplier' to 'Vendor', and 'Customer' to 'Client'. It's unclear if 'Vendor', 'Client' and 'Items' still refers to the same entities and goods described elsewhere in the contract as 'Supplier', 'Customer' and 'Product', leading to uncertainty in obligations.
